weather_report:
Under the quiet embrace of a moonlit night, Boston pauses in a moment of tranquil clarity, the air crisp with the impending chill that heralds winter's grip. A soft rustle of the northwest wind carries whispers of cold, setting a scene that feels both serene and sharp. As the city rests, illuminated by scattered lights, a low of twelve degrees beckons the mindful to wrap themselves in warm layers, embracing the comforts of wool and thick coats, perhaps complemented by a cozy scarf and a sturdy hat to shield against the cool night's breath.

Tomorrow, the sun will rise with an invigorating promise, casting bright rays across a vibrant, snow-flecked canvas. A high near thirty-six offers a glimmer of warmth, although wind chill may dip to near zero, reminding all to tread carefully through the beauty of a wintry day. As the city stretches awake, the promise of sunshine invites brisk walks along the Charles, coffee in hand, allowing the warmth of the sun to meet the coolness of the air in an enchanting dance. Or one might find solace in a neighborhood café, sipping a steaming brew while engaging in leisurely conversation with friends. If adventure calls, consider a museum visit, where the fascinating tales of art and history will feel all the more inviting against the backdrop of this clear, fresh day.
